CatDescriptText: Mack Johnson, 2325 Wylie Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 5, 1958, pg. 1 with question: "What do you think is wrong with the Pittsburgh Pirates? Do you think that they are using their best ball players at all times?" answer reads: "I'm strictly a Whitesox man.  As for the Pirates, I don't know what is wrong with them.  They are doing a lot of throwing away of games.  They have some good players.  Some compare with the best in league.  To me, they should be using Stevens instead of Kluszewski.  I don't think that the latter's back will hold up and he can't hit when it is needed."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mack Johnson wearing pants with dark belt, checker patterned button down short sleeve collared shirt, work gloves, and cap, standing in front of concrete or stone slab
